paper_abstract: In recent years. heterogeneous devices have been employed frequently in mobile storage systems because a combination of such devices can supply it synergistically useful storage solution by taking advantage of each device, One important design constraint in heterogeneous storage systems is to mitigate I/O performance degradation stemming from the difference between access times of different devices. To this end. there has not been much work to devise proper buffer cache management algorithms. This paper presents it novel huller cache management algorithm which considers both I/O cost per device and workload patterns in mobile computing systems with it heterogeneous storage pair of a hard disk all a NAND flash memory. In order to minimize the total I/O cost under varying workload patterns, the proposed algorithm employs a dynamic cache partitioning technique over different devices and manages each partition according to request patterns and I/O types along with the temporal locality. Trace-based Simulations show that the proposed algorithm reduces the total I/O cost and flash write count significantly over the existing buffer cache algorithms on typical mobile traces.
paper_title: DAC: A Device-Aware Cache Management Algorithm for Heterogeneous Mobile Storage Systems
